text: Mohammad Mo'men Khan Shamlu (), was a Turkoman nobleman from the Shamlu tribe, who served as the vizier of the Safavid king (shah) Sultan Husayn (r. 1694–1722) from 1699 to 1707. He had a son named Mohammad Qoli Khan Shamlu. == Sources == * Category:Grand Viziers of the Safavid Empire Category:Iranian Turkmen people Category:17th-century births Category:18th-century deaths Category:Year of death unknown Category:Shamlu Category:17th-century people of the Safavid Empire Category:18th-century people of the Safavid Empire
title: Mohammad Mo'men Khan Shamlu
